sentences.en: After verification, these rumors do not substantiated, Science City is clarification.
sentences.cn: 经核实, 上述传闻事项不属实, 科学城现予以澄清说明.

sentences.en: All protests will be substantiated through the use of a polygraph.
sentences.cn: 任何不负责任的语言甚至是谩骂是绝对不允许的.

sentences.en: Earlier reports of gunshots have not been substantiated.
sentences.cn: 早先有关枪击的那些报道尚未得到证实。

sentences.en: Finally, the method is substantiated valid through example computation and analysis.
sentences.cn: 最后, 通过实例计算和分析证实了本文方法的有效性.

sentences.en: Our ideas must be substantiated into actions.
sentences.cn: 我们的想法必须通过具体的行动来实现.

sentences.en: The drop in transactions at the autumn Guangzhou fair in 2001 substantiated this.
sentences.cn: 下拉的交易在秋季广州交易会2001年属实.

sentences.en: The percolation transition of this system at percolation threshold P _ c was substantiated by Monte Carlo simulation.
sentences.cn: 蒙特卡洛方法模拟验证了该体系在逾渗阈值处的相变行为.

sentences.en: The results of the tests substantiated his claims.
sentences.cn: 这些检验的结果证实了他的说法。

sentences.en: The statement has never been substantiated.
sentences.cn: 这一陈述从未得到证实.

sentences.en: The theory of atoms was substantiated to a large extent by experiments in chemistry.
sentences.cn: 原子的理论在很大程度上是由化学实验来证实的.

sentences.en: There is little scientific evidence to substantiate the claims.
sentences.cn: 几乎没有能证实这些断言的科学证据。

sentences.en: This article is vague and general in content and must be substantiated.
sentences.cn: 这篇文章内容空泛,必须加以充实.

words.tran_cn: 大量的；实质的；内容充实的
有实质的；大量的；真实的；独立存在的
实体；实质性；真实价值；内容
名词性实词；独立存在的实体
证明；充实（substantiate的过去分词）；使具体化

trans.tran_cn: 用事实支持（某主张、说法等），证明，证实( substantiate的过去式和过去分词 )

trans.tran_en: To substantiate a statement or a story means to supply evidence which proves that it is true
